oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1948-07-24 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry show from July 7, 1948. Featuring Louie Buck (announcer), Red Foley (host, performer), Ernest Tubb (performer), Tommy 'Butterball' Paige (performer), Old Hickory Singers including Claude Sharpe (performers), Minnie Pearl (performer), Eggie McEwen (performer), Rod Brasfield (performer), Wally Fowler and his Oak Ridge Quartet (performers), Floyd Ethridge (performer), and Milton Estes (performer). Part 2: http://cmfdigitization.cmf.int:2011/cdm/ref/collection/musicaudio/id/634
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Red Foley; Old Hickory Singers; Ernest Tubb; Minnie Pearl
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Warren Paint commercial (Grant Turner) -- Warren Paint jingle -- Tide commercial -- NBC special news bulletin regarding Henry Wallace -- Opening theme -- Opening statement (Louie Buck) -- Rockin' Chair Money (Red Foley) -- Red Foley introduces Claude Sharpe and the Old Hickory Singers -- Tuck Me To Sleep In My Old 'Tucky Home (Old Hickory Singers) -- Prince Albert commercial (Louie Buck) -- Prince Albert jingle (Old Hickory Singers) -- Red Foley introduces Ernest Tubb -- You Nearly Lose Your Mind (Ernest Tubb) -- Red Foley introduces Minnie Pearl -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl) -- Lay Down Your Soul (Red Foley)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Foley, Red, 1910-1968; Tubb, Ernest, 1914-1984; Paige, Tommy; Old Hickory Singers; Sharpe, Claude, 1902-1969; McEwen, Eggie; Minnie Pearl; Brasfield, Rod; Fowler, Wally; Oak Ridge Boys; Ethridge, Floyd, 1908-1981; Estes, Milton, 1914-1963
